pages.title: Wagwan Oscroh,
pages.content: I have been thinking about this past year and I realized I could not look back without appreciating you properly. You have been more than just a friend. You have been someone I could talk to honestly, laugh with, think out loud with, and just be myself around. That means a lot to me, and I do not take it for granted at all.

pages.title: What You Mean To Me
pages.content: There were moments this year that would have felt heavier or lonelier if you were not around, whether it was through our random conversations, your advice, shared jokes, or just your presence. You have shown consistency, loyalty, and a kind of quiet support that many people do not know how to give. You are the type of person who makes life feel a little lighter, and I am genuinely grateful for that.

pages.title: Your Impact
pages.content: I respect the way you think, the way you handle situations, and the kind of person you are growing into. You inspire me in your own way through your mindset, your resilience, and the way you always try to be better. You have had a real impact on my year, even in ways you may not fully realize.

pages.title: Thank You
pages.content: Thank you for the times you checked in, the times you listened, the times you challenged me, and the times we just laughed about nonsense. Thank you for showing up as a real friend, not just when things were fun, but when they were uncertain too. People like you are rare, and I am genuinely glad our paths crossed.

pages.title: Looking Forward
pages.content: As we move into a new year, I am rooting for you. Your growth, your wins, your peace, and everything you are working towards. I pray you find clarity where you need it, strength when things get tough, and joy in the small moments along the way. You deserve good things, and I hope this year brings you even more of them.

pages.title: With Gratitude
pages.content: I appreciate you deeply, bro. Thanks for being you, and thanks for being a solid part of my life this past year. More life, more growth, and more moments ahead.\n\n Murewa

pages.title: Movies for 2026
list: The Killing of a Sacred Deer

tarotCard.name: The Lovers
tarotCard.meaning:
The Lovers card represents alignment, loyalty, and meaningful connections the kind of bond that helps you grow and stay grounded. When I think of our friendship, it reminds me of that energy. You’ve been someone I can trust and be real with, and I really value the presence and clarity you bring into my life./nFor 2026, I pray it becomes a Lovers-card kind of year for you: a year of good decisions, the right people around you, peace in your journey, and opportunities that align with your purpose and values. May every choice you make lead you closer to the life you’re building, and may your relationships bring you strength, clarity, and joy.
I appreciate you, and I’m rooting for everything ahead of you this year

pages.title: Dear Olamide,
pages.content: As we step into 2025, I wanted to share some thoughts with you...
2024 was a year of growth, challenges, and beautiful moments. Through it all, you've shown incredible resilience and grace.

recipient: Oluwole Afolabi (My man, my love, oorz)

pages.title: Hey Oluwole,
pages.content: I have been thinking about this past year a lot, and honestly, I could not think about it without thinking about you. So I just wanted to sit down and actually write this to you, because you have been a huge part of my year in ways I do not think I have said out loud enough.

pages.title: Through It All
pages.content: This year was not perfect. It had wins, losses, frustrations, funny moments, tired days, and confusing phases. But through all of that, you were there, not just as someone I talk to once in a while, but as someone who was present. We worked on projects together, shared ideas, encouraged each other, argued sometimes, came back again, and still chose to keep showing up for the friendship. That means a lot to me.

pages.title: Building Together
pages.content: Working with you never felt like just work. It felt like building with someone who honestly cares, someone who is invested in both the project and the person they are working with. There were days when things were stressful, or when plans were not making sense, and your presence alone made it easier to keep going. You bring this energy that makes things feel possible, even when they are tough.

pages.title: Beyond Work
pages.content: I also really value how our friendship exists outside of work. The times we went out, talked, laughed about the most random things, reflected on life, or just chilled, those moments mattered to me. They grounded me. They reminded me that life is more than pressure and goals. It is also about the people you go through it with.

pages.title: Being There
pages.content: And this year especially, I am grateful for the way we were there for each other when things got heavy. You went through your breakup, and even though I could not fix anything, I wanted to be there in whatever way I could. To listen, to talk, or just sit in silence if that was what you needed. Then when I went through that rejection, you did not just brush it off or give surface words. You understood. You encouraged me. You stayed present too. That kind of mutual support is rare, and I do not take it for granted.

pages.title: Shared Victories
pages.content: Helping you get that job and then watching you actually step into it and do your thing was one of those moments that made me genuinely happy. Not just because it worked out, but because I know how much effort, growth, and intention you have been putting into your life. Seeing you win felt personal, like a shared victory.

pages.title: What You Mean To Me
pages.content: You are one of those friends that makes life feel less lonely. Someone I can talk to about real things. Someone I can be honest with without pretending. Someone who understands that friendship is not perfect, but still chooses to show up consistently. And that is something I deeply respect and appreciate about you.

pages.title: Looking Forward
pages.content: As we head into a new year, I am honestly rooting for you in every sense. I pray 2026 treats you kindly. I hope it gives you peace where you have carried weight, strength where you have been stretched, and joy in both the big and small moments. I hope your work opens the right doors, your growth becomes clearer even when the process feels slow, and you continue becoming the person you are meant to be.

pages.title: You Deserve Good Things
pages.content: You deserve good things, not just because you work hard, but because of the kind of person you are. Loyal, sincere, thoughtful, intentional, and real. I am grateful that I get to call you my friend, and I do not take that lightly at all.

pages.title: Thank You
pages.content:
Thank you for this year. For the conversations, the support, the jokes, the healing moments, the projects, the encouragement, and just your presence. You have been a solid part of my journey, and I appreciate you more than I probably say.

More life, more growth, more wins, more peace, and more memories ahead.

Oorz,
Murewa

tarotCard.name: The Hermit
tarotCard.meaning: Solitude brings clarity. This year, take time for reflection and self-discovery. The answers you seek are within you. Your introspection and thoughtful nature will guide you to deeper wisdom and understanding.
